item.title: Forestry Service Roads
item.author: Author
item.description: Wrote lesson content, designed safety course, devised evaluation criteria, drafted policy, and created reference materials for traveling on Alberta's forestry service roads (FSRs)

item.title: Onboarding Indigenous Monitors
item.author: Author
item.description: 1 Problem Question How are we evaluating the onboarding process? 2 Process 3 Solution Redesigned onboarding procedure 1/3 Redisigned onboarding procedure 2/3 Redesigned onboarding procedure 3/3

item.title: Pipeline Compliance & Documentation
item.author: Author
item.description: 1 Overview Background The Canada Energy Regulator (CER) works to protect the future of the Canadian energy industry by developing projects which engage with Indigenous communities to ensure energy projects operate safely and under the strictest environmental standards. A key participant in this process are the Indigneous Monitors (IM): Quote Indigenous peoples, the Government of Canada, and the CER worked together to create the Indigenous Advisory and Monitoring Committees, or IAMCs.
